sentences: Hän teki vierailun vanhan ystävänsä luona.
Vierailujen aikana näimme paljon mielenkiintoisia paikkoja.
context: The Finnish word 'vierailun' is the partitive singular form of 'vierailu', which means 'visit'. The '-n' ending indicates it's in the partitive case, often used to indicate an incomplete action or when the object doesn't have a definite boundary. In English, this would be expressed as 'a visit' or 'of the visit' depending on context.
